isis.stitle: HENDRICKSON SUSPENSION SYSTEMS - BUSHING REPLACEMENT - BEAM ASSEMBLY (BOTH)

step1.para: Raise axles and support vehicle by the frame. Use frame stands.

warning.para: A jack must never be used alone to support vehicle while under-chassis service is being per- formed. The jack may lower and serious personal injury could result. Always support vehicle with floor stands.

step1.para: Remove ALL wheels from both rear axles. Refer to Group 17-RIMS, WHEELS and TIRES in the CTS-5000 Master Service Manual.
Remove all beam ends. Use procedures as described in preceding instructions pertaining to specific beam end.
Support axles with stands placed under or supporting differential carriers.
With beam being supported with jack, remove saddle caps from both beams.
Lower jack supporting beams. If beams are stuck, pry beams free.

warning.para: Take care when prying the beam that the beam does not fall and cause personal injury.

step1.para: With beams lowered, slide beam off cross tube. Remove beams and cross tube from under carriage.
Lubricate tube ends with chassis grease and slide cross tube and beam under vehicle rear suspension.
Slide cross tube into beams. Using jacks and an assistant if necessary, raise beam assembly into position.
Install beam ends as described previously in Beam End Installation.
Install saddle caps; tighten cap nuts to specifications. Refer to the TORQUE CHART.
Remove all jacks, supporting axles and beams.
Install wheels. Refer to GROUP 17- RIMS, WHEELS AND TIRES in the CTS-5000 Master Service Manual.
Remove frame stands and lower vehicle.
Road test vehicle for proper operation before putting vehicle back into service.
